member.name: F:FsInfoCat.AppDataPathLevel.CultureSpecific
member.summary: The directory that serves as a common repository for version and culture-specific application data that is used by the current, non-roaming user.
member.remarks: This refers to a subdirectory named after a specific Name, and is located within the version-specific local application data subdirectory.

member.name: F:FsInfoCat.AppDataPathLevel.CurrentVersion
member.summary: The directory that serves as a common repository for culture-invariant, version-specific application data that is used by the current, non-roaming user.
member.remarks: This refers to a subdirectory named after the application's Assembly Version, and is located within the general assembly app data subdirectory.

member.name: F:FsInfoCat.AppDataPathLevel.Assembly
member.summary: The parent directory containing assembly data that is used by the current, non-roaming user.
member.remarks: This refers to a subdirectory named after the application's Assembly Name, and is located within the product-specific app data subdirectory.

member.name: F:FsInfoCat.AppDataPathLevel.Product
member.summary: The parent directory for product-specific data that is used by the current, non-roaming user.
member.remarks: This refers to a subdirectory named after the application's Product Name, and is located within the company-specific app data subdirectory.

member.name: F:FsInfoCat.AppDataPathLevel.Company
member.summary: TThe directory that serves as a common repository for application-independent, company-specific data that is used by the current, non-roaming user.
member.remarks: This refers to a subdirectory that has the same name as the company which is specified in the AssemblyCompany, and is located within the Local Application Data special folder.

member.name: P:FsInfoCat.DbEntity.CreatedOn
member.summary: Gets or sets the database entity creation date/time.
member.value: The date and time when the database entity was created.
member.remarks:
This value is automatically updated before it is inserted into the database.
For local databases, this value is the system- date and time. For upstream (remote) databases, this is the UTC date and time.

member.name: P:FsInfoCat.DbEntity.ModifiedOn
member.summary: Gets or sets the database entity modification date/time.
member.value: The date and time when the database entity was last modified.
member.remarks:
This value is automatically updated before it is saved to the database.
For local databases, this value is the system- date and time. For upstream (remote) databases, this is the UTC date and time.

member.name: P:FsInfoCat.ISummaryProperties.ItemType
member.summary: Gets the canonical item type.
member.value: The canonical type of the item, intended to be programmatically parsed.
member.remarks:
This value should be white-space normalized and trimmed, with white-space-only converted to .
If there is no canonical type, the value is VT_EMPTY. If the item is a file (ie, System.FileName is not VT_EMPTY), the value is the same as System.FileExtension.Use System.ItemTypeText when you want to display the type to end users in a view. (If the item is a file, passing the System.ItemType value to PSFormatForDisplay will result in the same value as System.ItemTypeText.)
Name Item Type
Format ID {28636AA6-953D-11D2-B5D6-00C04FD918D0} (ShellDetails)

[Reference Link]

member.name: P:FsInfoCat.ISummaryProperties.ItemTypeText
member.summary: Gets the item type name.
member.value: This is the user friendly type name of the item.
member.remarks:
This value should be trimmed, with white-space-only converted to .
This is not intended to be programmatically parsed. If System.ItemType is VT_EMPTY, the value of this property is also VT_EMPTY. If the item is a file, the value of this property is the same as if you passed the file's System.ItemType value to PSFormatForDisplay. This property should not be confused with System.Kind, where System.Kind is a high-level user friendly kind name.
Name Item Type

member.typeparam: The type of synchronized collection on which events can be deferred.
member.param: The synchronized collection.
The boolean value, passed by reference, to track whether the lock was acquired. This must be upon invocation.

The that can enqueue (defer) delegates, and executes them after all instances referencing the object are disposed or until explicitly executed. This will be if the collection is , not synchronized ( is ), or is or could not be accessed.
member.returns: if the is synchronized and a lock was obtained on the object; otherwise, .

member.name: T:FsInfoCat.DeferredDelegation.IDelegateDeference
member.summary:
Provides methods for deferring delegate methods along with thread-exclusive synchonization locking for a target object.
Implements the interface.
member.remarks:
Each instance of this interface created using methods from the maintains a thread-exclusive lock on a synchronization object /// that is intended to facilitate synchronized access to a target object. Delegates, such as event invocations, can be deferred using this interface to mitigate the chances of other code being executed which may result in untimely modifications or deadlocks.
Deferred delegates are invoked when the last IDelegateDeference instance sharing the same target object is disposed or when is invoked.

member.name: T:FsInfoCat.DeferredDelegation.IDelegateDeference`1

member.remarks:
Each instance of this interface created using methods from the maintains a thread-exclusive lock on a synchronization object that is intended to facilitate synchronized access to a target object. Delegates, such as event invocations, can be deferred using this interface to mitigate the chances of other code being executed which may result in untimely modifications or deadlocks.
Deferred delegates are invoked when the last IDelegateDeference instance sharing the same target object is disposed or when is invoked.

member.name: T:FsInfoCat.Upstream.IFileAction
member.summary: Describes an action to be taken on a file.

member.name: P:FsInfoCat.Upstream.IFileAction.Task
member.summary: Gets the parent mitigation task.
member.value: The parent mitigation task.

member.name: P:FsInfoCat.Upstream.IFileAction.Source
member.summary: Gets the source file.
member.value: The source file that needs to be deleted, moved or copied.

member.name: P:FsInfoCat.Upstream.IFileAction.Destination
member.summary: Gets the destination subdirectory.
member.value: The destination or if the file does not get copied or moved.
member.remarks:
The file options flag and the file status combined with the value of this field determines whether a file should be deleted, moved or copied, as follows:
Destination Options/Status Action
options flag is set or is not . Delete
Not options flag is set or is not . Move
Not is and options flag is not set. Copy

member.name: P:FsInfoCat.Upstream.ISubdirectoryAction.Destination
member.summary: Gets the destination subdirectory.
member.value: The destination or if the subdirectory does not get copied or moved.
member.remarks:
The file options flag combined with the value of this field determines whether a file should be deleted, moved or copied, as follows:
Destination Options Action
options flag is set: Delete
Not options flag is set: Move
Not options flag is not set. Copy
